newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kinkel says EU integration needs "second wind".
newsitem.headline: Kinkel says EU integration needs "second wind".

text.p: German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel said in an interview on Friday that the European Union was losing its momentum towards integration and needed a "second wind" to complete its planned reforms by the time of a summit in Amsterdam next month.
But Kinkel told the Handelsblatt business daily he thought an informal summit of EU leaders on Friday in the Dutch resort of Noordwijk would make progress on the reform package.

Kinkel said the new British government was more flexible than its predecessor on issues like qualified majority voting and strengthening the European Parliament, but noted London still insisted on national interests in many cases.
In general, European states were less interested in integration since the end of the Cold War, he added.
"The readiness to integrate and communitarise has waned somewhat," he said. "We're on the home stretch now and, as the athletes would say, we need a second wind."
